campaign.story:
Avey Grouws Band: "Tell-Tale Heart" Kickstart(er)
You all know what this last year has been like, and Kickstarter is telling me to be brief. So first, let us just say thank you! And second, we're so excited about this next album! 
When we released "The Devil May Care" on March 20, 2020, we had no idea what lay ahead. On that day we went into pandemic shut down and lost over a year of touring and revenue. But we adapted and grew, managing to do over 100 live streams from the apartment, getting the album out to the public, hitting #10 on the Billboard Blues Chart, being nominated for multiple industry awards and songwriting competitions, hitting charts across the globe, managing to wind up on an array of "Best of 2020" album and song charts (even hitting #1 spots on a few of them?!) and, best of all, expanding our friend/fan base to new folks around the world. Yes, it absolutely was a difficult year for us all....but it was also a year of renewal, growth and learning.
"Tell-Tale Heart" was born of this strangely difficult but beautiful time. The 10 tracks were all written during this past year and they are full of reality. They reflect the good times and the bad, the joy and the tears. They tell stories of life in a way that feels 100% us. Blues, Roots, Rock, Americana, all mixing to form the AGB sound you know. We can't wait for you to hear it and we can't wait to share this with the larger world!
In April, we headed down to Nashville to record with Grammy winning engineer/producer, Casey Wasner (Keb' Mo', Taj Mahal, Robben Ford), spending much of the first week at the super vibey East Iris Recording Studios in Berry Hill, this tiny town inside of Nashville. This place was not only visually and creatively appealing, but it also had all of the space we needed to record together as a band and get the sound we wanted. That was the most important thing for us on this album.
East Iris...what a place to record!
The hall separating The Cave (mixing room) from the Sun Room, a replica of Sun Studios in Memphis. As the vocalist, Jeni had her own suite. Ooh la la!
Casey Wasner (left) and Ross Collier (right) worked hard to get the sound just right and yet somehow stayed totally chill the entire time. Love these guys. Note: You can see the Sun Room behind them in the window.
After we recorded all 10 tracks at East Iris, we spent the next couple of weeks working on the mix at The Purple House in Leiper's Fork, TN. The Purple House is Casey Wasner's studio out in the Tennessee hills, and it couldn't have been a better place for us to not only spend the time we needed to mix the album, but also for us to learn. It's clear that Casey has absorbed so much in his time touring on drums with Keb' Mo', on guitar with Robben Ford and in all of his efforts in the studio with various artists. Lucky for us, he passed bits of that knowledge on to us during the mixing experience and we are definitely better musicians because of that time. And even more importantly, the album was given the attention it deserved during these 2 weeks.  We can't wait for you to hear "Tell-Tale Heart", and we really can't wait to share it with the greater music community.
Chris Avey plays on Robben Ford's guitar at The Purple House while Casey Wasner works on the mix.
Bryan West, Casey Wasner, Jeni Grouws and Chris Avey on wrap day!
 Here's where we need you! The album is recorded. But we need to get it out there and the only way we can do that is to get some of these expenses covered by selling you fun stuff! While you are welcome to simply make a donation, our real opportunity here is to give you the chance to support this album before its release date by purchasing different reward levels offered in this Kickstarter. From pre-releases of the album and T-shirts, to drum lessons and house parties, it's all here! This is the only way that you will be able to get the album before anyone else....and if it's a hardcopy, we'll sign it for you, too! In addition, Kickstarter allowed us to offer Add Ons, so you can support at one level and then click an add on to also get a t-shirt, or a coozie, or a sticker without having to support two separate levels. It's very cool and very exciting!
If you are interested in finances, this album is going to cost around $25,000. We are still an independent band. We do not have the support of a label with an entire team working to push this album forward, though a second album like this could help us find that support in the future! Between studio booking, mixing time, producer costs, mastering, printing, travel expenses including food and lodging, marketing, PR photos, hiring a publicist, album art, kickstarter taxes, etc, it all adds up pretty quickly. Since we couldn't tour the last album, we didn't sell the amount of merch that we hoped to sell to help pay for this album. We have covered a little over 11k ourselves. We are keeping our campaign to $16,000 (of the $25,000 project) because over $2,000 of that goes toward kickstarter fees, processing fees and taxes and the $14,000 will go toward covering the rest of our expenses on this album. If we do go over our goal, we may be able to make a music video! But we're not getting greedy, we just want to make our goal. And hopefully we have some great rewards here that will get you excited about helping us get this album out to the world!
We have worked hard, pushed through and are ready to give this album wings, but we can't do it without you. We say it all the time, but truly, we are so grateful that you are there for us. The journey ahead is going to be exciting. Thank you for traveling with us!
Love, Avey Grouws Band
Chris Avey, Bryan West, Randy Leasman, Nick Vasquez and Jeni Grouws
During a break at East Iris Studios. We were tired, a bit haggard and super happy to be there!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This biggest risk here is that we don't reach $16,000. Kickstarter has a policy that, if it's not fully funded by the deadline, then we don't get any of the money and you get refunded your investment. You can help us by sharing this and by telling everyone you know about this album so that they, too, can get their pre-release album. They don't have to think of it as a donation, just a pre-release purchase, but it really does help us on this end of things.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Wow, wow, wow. 165 backers pledged $19,439 to help us not only reach our goal, but exceed it! We couldn't be more excited and more grateful!

In the next couple of days, we'll get more information on who backed us and at what levels, and you will hear from us eventually. But for now, we hope you'll join us in celebrating the fact that Tell Tale Heart, and all of the marketing, publicity and promotions that go along with a new album, will move forward!

First, HOLY COW, we are getting there! We're totally going to do this, and we couldn't be more excited and grateful. So close now!
For those of you asking about tshirt rewards, once we hit June 21, it takes a few days but, if we're funded, Kickstarter will send us the backer list. Once we see who has tshirts, we'll email you and ask what size you want. These are going to be custom made for you! Sorry we weren't more clear about that, but don't worry, we've got you...just like you've got us!

Thank you all so much. We've come so far in just 4 days! We are currently at 32% of our $16,000 goal, and we're feeling positive. We know not everyone is interested in the big ticket items, and that is perfectly ok! But remember, if you're hoping to get our new album first, whether digitally or on hardcopy CD, THIS is the place to do it. 
So for those of you that have purchased, remember to tell your friends and other music lovers.  And if you haven't had time yet, we've got until June 21st...plenty of time.

campaign.story:
We did it! Avey/Grouws Band finally made our debut album!
The Devil May Care will be independently released in March of this year. 10 tracks, all original music that came from our hearts and our souls. Iowa musicians, recorded at Catamount Recording in Cedar Falls, Iowa, with original linocut and digital artwork created by Iowa artist, Nick Hirka and album layout crafted by Iowa graphic designer, Deb Paulson. Yes, we could've gone to record somewhere else and worked with folks from across the country. But we wanted to keep our work, and our money, as local as possible. There is talent all around these Heartland states and we wanted to showcase them as well!
Well the project is finally done and it has exceeded our expectations! We can't wait for you, our family, friends and fans, to hear it. Recently, we've had conversations with people much wiser than we are, and they all  ask the same thing: If you've put together this terrific album, why not get it the attention it deserves? It's a fair question. This album needs to go beyond our usual touring radius. It has the chance to do well if the right people hear it. But that can get expensive. When we started this process, we did not want to ask for help and we were able to get the album completed. But we had no idea how much money really does go into writing, recording, mixing, mastering, producing and then promoting and marketing an album to the right people. So here we are, ready to release a promising album, but we're stuck. We need your help to get this album to the next level!
The basics facts are: We are looking at a minimum of $6,000 to get the publicity, and the publicist, that we need. So we are asking to reach that minimum with our kickstarter. If we go over, please know that it will all go towards marketing this album.
We're proud Midwesterners, so please note: This is not a donation. We are asking you to look at our offerings, including ordering pre-release cds, exclusive t-shirts, flash drives, parties and more, and see if there is something you might be interested in investing in to support us. We know you're excited and lovely and generous, but we want to be sure you get value in return! 
If ever we were going to make a dent in the wider music scene, this is the time. But we can't do it alone. As our community of friends, we know you're excited for us, too, and for that we are truly grateful. So take a look and do what you can. Every single one of you that is able to support in some way, at any level, makes a giant difference in the end! So see what you can do, help us if you can and, if you REALLY want to go above and beyond, share the HECK out of this on social media. You never know who might be in a position to support new music.
Thank you. Thank you for having confidence in us, for dancing with us, for crying with us, for the gestures, big and small, for enjoying our music, giving us food and feedback and for sharing a toast with us now and again. This journey is so much more than those of us in the band. You are a part of it with us and we wouldn't have it any other way. Now let's get this album to the next level! 
Keep an eye on the kickstarter with us on facebook and on Instagram! And share, share, share. 
With love and gratitude,
Avey/Grouws Band
AGB at Catamount Recording, Cedar Falls, Iowa

updates.update_userinfo: Only $1,250 to go! Plus the party....
updates.update_content:
We're 15 days til the end and only $1,250 to go! Thank you all! For those asking, the reward for the listening party, it's officially for 2 people (people asked before and I wasn't sure, so now it's official!) and comes with 1 album, snacks, drinks, and good times with all of us at the listening party! That will be hosted in the Quad Cities on Thursday March 12th. This should be an incredible good time together. If you have more questions about the kickstarter or our project, just shoot us a message. Thank you all again for your support. This album has been a dream for us and it's already doing what we hoped it could do. More announcements coming soon!
AGB

Let's Do This!  We are so close to our goal and we're hoping we can get there and perhaps beyond. Thank you to those of you that have supported and thank you to those of you that have shared our kickstarter with your friends! This album really does have some potential legs to go bigger than we had even imagined. Here is just a few lines from a terrific review:
Thanks to R. Bowen for these words:  'The mix of mid-western muscle and southern charm is reflected in the passionate, powerful and playful music of the band’s debut full-length album, “The Devil May Care.” The ten original tracks were written by the dynamic duo of Jeni Grouws and Chris Avey. Grouws has an alto that can blow like a cool breeze or thunder like a Kansas tornado, and Avey is a skilled guitarist that has drawn quick comparisons to Coco Montoya and Robben Ford...... The depth and strength of this strong debut, “The Devil May Care,” should garner national attention for the group of musicians, who are the pride of the Quad Cities and well represent the talent grown in that area of the Mississippi Valley.'  Here we go, Friends!

updates.update_userinfo: And we're off to an incredible start!

Thank you, Friends! 💛

campaign.story:
***CURRENT STATUS, APRIL 16TH: REACHING TOWARDS END GOAL OF $40K! THANK YOU!!***
(scroll to bottom to read more)
Thank you to everyone who has joined so far!
(Kickstarter is an "all-or-nothing" crowd-funding platform. The artist has a 30-day window to successfully fund this project. If this project does not reach its first goal of $26k, your card will not be charged and the artist will not receive any money. Kickstarter takes 5% and card processing fees take an additional 3-5%) ________________________________________________________________
                                                     THANK YOU for being here with us!

THE MISSION:
Our intention for this Kickstarter campaign is for it to be a mutually beneficial endeavor! YOU receive the new music before the album is officially released in Summer 2019, as well as access to special bonus offerings. In turn, your support allows us to launch this project and fund a publicity campaign so that this music may be heard by a wider audience. As the music industry has largely shifted to online streaming outlets, music sales have greatly declined...so, your support is now more important than ever. 
We hope this new music inspires you, incites positive change, and allows space for reflection, tears, dancing, shedding of old skin, and that it keeps you and yours in good company. As our community of supporters, you have kept us on the road as independent musicians, and we are forever grateful to you for believing in what we do over all these years. This relationship between us is really what this is all about. We've put everything we have into this new album on our own, and now we're asking for you to join us in helping to get this music out into the world! 
(photo by Laura Totten Photography)
NEW NAME
Since 2010 we've been touring steadily throughout the U.S. and Europe as "Dave McGraw & Mandy Fer" and have recently changed our band name to - "SWAY WILD!" Over the last couple of years, we've done a lot of soul-searching. We even took a brief moment away from the road to breathe a little deeper and find some stillness. During that time, something beautiful cracked open, and music began flowing through us like we'd never experienced before. Mandy, with her fingers inseparable from the electric guitar, tapped into her muse, her inner wild perhaps, and out came more songs than we could even keep track of. Dave returned to his native instrument of the drums, and longtime friend and bassist Thom Lord moved into the neighborhood and rejoined the venture with contagious enthusiasm.
Together, we began collaborating and writing in entirely new ways.
But it is still very much us. 
Us growing. 
We’re giddy with an almost childlike enthusiasm about all of this and the new material feels so fresh, invigorating, and fun. It only seems right to mark this new growth with a new name. We are now Sway Wild.
NEW ALBUM
Sway Wild (the name of the band and the new album!) captures this growth and is the culmination of everything we've been working on for the last two years. Between early December, 2018 and mid February, 2019 we traveled back and forth from our home of San Juan Island, WA to Portland, OR where we recorded at the beautiful and historic Hallowed Halls recording studio (formerly a public library from 1919-1972!) We had the opportunity to record with engineer-extraordinaire Justin Phelps, whose resume speaks for itself (see below). Credentials aside, Justin was eternally positive, enthusiastic (adequately caffeinated), incredibly talented, and hard-working. We spent an entire planetary season with him sculpting this record and bringing it to life together. He truly cared, and it shows.  
With Justin at the helm, we assembled a team of some of the finest musicians we've ever had the honor to work with. 
THE TEAM                                             
                                                             GUEST MUSICIANS
 Anna Tivel: violin, vocals
 Anthony Meade (MarchFourth, Sepiatonic): trombone, horn arrangements
 Paul 'Pablo' Chandler (MarchFourth, Orgone): trumpet
 Jon VanCura (MarchFourth): baritone & tenor saxophone
 Skip VonKuske (Portland Cello Project): cello
 Allison Russell (Birds of Chicago, Songs of our Native Daughters): vocals
 JT Nero (Birds of Chicago): vocals
 Anna Fritz (Bizarre Stars): cello
 Sean Hayes: vocals
                                                         RECORDING & MIXING ENGINEER
 Justin Phelps, Portland, OR. (Cake, Bob Weir, Amanda Palmer, Galactic, Neville Brothers, Jolie Holland, Y La Bamba, Leftover Salmon and hundreds of others!)
                                                                  MASTERING ENGINEER
 Ed Brooks-Resonant Mastering, Seattle, WA. (Pearl Jam, Fleet Foxes, Death Cab for Cutie, R.E.M. and hundreds of others!)
                                                                         SWAY WILD
 Mandy Fer: vocals, electric & acoustic guitars, piano, Hammond B3 organ, xylophone, banjo, wind chimes
 Dave McGraw: vocals, drums, percussion, acoustic guitar, Hammond B3 organ
 Thom Lord: electric bass  
Recording at Hallowed Halls
YOU
In 2014, you, our Kickstarter community, allowed us to successfully launch and promote our sophomore release, Maritime. Your overwhelming support left us immensely grateful and deeply inspired. Maritime received press recognition in both the U.S. and Europe that gave us a real lift in our trajectory....all thanks to you! 
Now, with your involvement in this project for Sway Wild, we're aiming even higher in order to expand the reach and sustainability of this music. We are going to keep working hard, and these goals below help us to do so to the best of our abilities.
GOALS
OUR INITIAL GOAL: $26,000
 If we do not reach 26,000 in 30 days, your cards will not be charged and we will not receive any money.  If we do reach this initial goal, this will allow us to cover the costs of recording, mixing, and mastering of the album. (Costs listed below) We've listed stretch goals below in hopes to give this new album a shot at really being a success...Thank you!
OUR FIRST STRETCH GOAL: $32,000
will cover above + manufacturing + allow for a bare-minimum publicity campaign. Thank you!
 OUR SECOND STRETCH GOAL: $40,000 and above
We can make the best album possible, but if it isn't given wings it will never take off.
This goal will allow us to hire a NATIONAL PUBLICITY team/firm to increase our chances of catching an ear at major outlets such as NPR, Rolling Stone, etc...as well as helping to secure song placements on influential streaming playlists...These outlets would not only help our music reach a wider audience, but also contribute to our ability to expand our support team with well-established folks in the music biz who can provide more opportunities for growth/exposure.
This goal will allow for VIDEO production. Videos are invaluable to booking and promotion. You watch videos on the internet, right?! This is one of the most effective ways to expand our community and maintain the connection between our music and our listeners.
This goal will allow for effective TOUR PROMOTION which gets more people to our shows.
This goal may allow for a small RADIO campaign.
Thank you for believing that our music is worthy of greater exposure!
 COSTS: 
The financial realities of producing/releasing/promoting a professionally recorded album require some pretty heavy lifting. The costs for making Sway Wild include:
Equipment Rental 
Studio Rental 
Engineering/Mixing/Production 
Paying musicians 
Transportation
Accommodations/travel expenses
Album artwork, layout, and design
Mastering
Manufacturing CDs/Vinyl
Distribution
Publicity/Promotional campaign
Videography 
Kickstarter fees/mailings

SONGS:
 Below are a couple of teasers from the new album... Turn it up! (note: click on orange arrow to listen)
" Home (featuring Sean Hayes)"
"Comin' and Goin'" (w/ Birds of Chicago)
A note about estimated DELIVERY dates:
Because of the Kickstarter formatting we're not able to put in an estimated delivery time for each item individually. The MUSIC in digital download form will be delivered to you before the official US/EU release date sometime this summer! (exact release date tbd ) House Concerts, poetry books, special song compositions, vinyl etc.. will take a bit longer and we will coordinate with you individually to meet your hopes/needs for these rewards as best we can.
Various Kickstarter Offerings
Recording at Hallowed Halls
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Music is in our bones. It is who we are and what we do. The recording of 'Sway Wild' is done, the music has been captured, and there’s no looking back. We are working as hard as we possibly can every day both on and off the stage to bring this music to life. You’ve found meaning in our music, and encouraged us to keep at it...and we are, thanks to you. Great leaps of faith are not taken without some fears, but with you on our team, we're confident that we can do this!!! 

Please know how much it would mean to us if you share this project far and wide with your friends and family. Word of mouth is how this really works...indeed, this is crowdfunding, so let’s rally the crowd!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for being with us.

Mandy, Dave, & Thom
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
HI FOLKS! 
Welcome! I am honored to announce that I have the special opportunity to make a new, full-length record with one of the most in-demand producers in Austin, legendary troubadour, Walt Wilkins.
Most of you know my story - how meeting artist/producer Ray Bonneville at an airport changed my life and started my second career as a singer-songwriter following a 21-year career in the Marine Corps. The release of my debut album, Silver Line in 2015 sent me on an amazing, unexpected journey. I’m grateful and humbled to have had the opportunity to work with some incredibly gifted artists, many of whom have been my music heroes for a very long time. Lifelong friends I’ve made along the way include folks I’ve been privileged to share the stage with and many who occupy the most important seats in the house, the audience - you.
Clockwise, from top left: Chuck with Matt Harlan & Adam Carroll at Gruene Hall; Chuck & Libby Koch; Chuck with Ray Bonneville & Amber Cross; Chuck & Jon Napier; Chuck & Charlie Roth; Chuck with Michael Martin Murphey and band at the Saxon Pub in Austin
I have done my very best to work hard and honor the opportunities that I’ve been gifted. Over the past several years, I’ve played countless shows in Central Texas, maintained a local residency hosting some of the most talented songwriters around, and toured the U.S. and Europe multiple times. Recently, I made my debut as a producer for Jim Wyly’s critically-acclaimed album, The Artisan. Of all the things I get to do though, I am most proud to donate my time and energy to veteran’s causes, especially Dustin Welch’s Soldier Songs & Voices - a program dedicated to post-conflict care through free music and songwriting lessons to our veterans.
Clockwise, from top left: Jim Wyly's The Artisan; Chuck at the Soldier Songs & Voices Reveille Retreat; Chuck & George Ensle on the Kerrville Folk Festival Main Stage; Chuck with Libby Koch & Ordinary Elephant; Chuck & Ramblin' Jack Elliott; Chuck with Rob & Mark Ellen
This is what I’m supposed to be doing; I believe that. My job is to write, to pick up a guitar and sing songs for you and, hopefully in doing so, make this place a little better or that thing a little easier. I need your help to continue down this path.  
THE NEW RECORD
This record will be a collection of songs where the words are up front & natural... Songs you may have heard live before and some new ones I can’t wait for you to hear. The album will be recorded at Jumping Dog Studio in Austin with the talented Ron Flynt as the engineer. Walt will be bringing some of Austin’s finest musicians into the studio to play on this album...you’ll have to wait to find out which ones. I will be promoting the record in the U.S. and Europe for radio and press and current plans are to tour on both sides of the pond to support the release.
The Production Team - Ron Flynt, Chuck, and Walt Wilkins
HOW KICKSTARTER WORKS & WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES
In the new music industry, Kickstarter has become one of the primary ways for independent artists to make records. It allows us to offer our community of friends and fans music, merch, and memories in exchange for your much-needed support. So, when you support this Kickstarter project, you’re joining the production team. Together, we’re going to make something special, and I can’t wait to share it with you.  
If you’re interested to know where the money goes on a professional recording project, below is a breakdown of our working budget to record, manufacture, and promote this album the absolute best we can: 
PRODUCTION (Studio, Musicians, Producer, & Mixing): $15,000
MASTERING: $1,000
ARTWORK, GRAPHIC DESIGN, REBRANDING: $1,200
CD MANUFACTURING: $4,000
VIDEO PRODUCTION: $5,000
RADIO PROMOTION, PR, PUBLICITY (U.S. & Europe; includes shipping): $10,000
ADVERTISING (Social Media & Print): $1,500
MERCHANDISE & REWARD PRODUCTION: $2,000
KICKSTARTER FEES (at $25K Goal): $2,500
SHIPPING COSTS FOR KICKSTARTER REWARDS: $2,000
Obviously, this adds up to more than my goal of $25,000. However, a successfully funded Kickstarter will ensure the maximum amount we need to produce the album and the minimum amount it will take to promote it. I will either cover the remaining costs or reduce promotional expenses accordingly. The more we make, the more we can promote this thing and get the music out to as many listeners as we can.
Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing platform, meaning if we don’t meet the $25,000 goal, I won’t get any funds to produce the album. Even if you can't contribute your hard-earned money, I'd ask that you please share this campaign with your friends so we can get the word out.
THANK YOU!
This doesn’t work without you: the venues don’t stay open, the shows don’t get played, the albums don’t get made. I’m deeply grateful for your support these past years and I hope you’ll jump aboard my production team and help me make this record a reality.  
Thank you very much and Happy New Year!
Yours to a cinder,
Chuck
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Working with a team like Walt Wilkins and Ron Flynt makes me confident that this is going to be a great record. There’s some risk that unforeseen circumstances could delay the album’s release once it’s recorded, but your support of this Kickstarter will ensure that I’ll have plenty of resources to get things done the right way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Patron Of the Arts
support.descp:
This level of giving is about acknowledging that art has inherent value, and that you believe that I should be able to spend more time writing songs and doing what I love. More now than at any time in the last 50-75 years, patronage of this level is helping more art (and more diverse art) get made.
If you are giving at this level, I invite you tell me what would feel rewarding to you to receive. Would you like to come spend a day in the Studio? Can I write and record you a song? In my experience, angels of the arts like you aren't in it for the swag or rewards. You do it because you see worth in my art and you want to lift that art up so it can soar even further. If this is you, WOW. I'm overwhelmed with gratitude for your support, your belief, your generosity, your kindness. Let's talk soon so I can extend my thanks in a way that is meaningful to you.

support.title: Take my hand

Please share this campaign with others to help spread awareness about mental health issues!

support.title: ON SALE: ✫⇢ One-2-One + CD + T-Shirt ⇠✫
support.descp:
Want a little one-on-one time? Or maybe you know someone who could use a compassionate ear. I get it. Empathy is one of my super powers. Whether to cheer you on with positivity, or to just sit quietly and listen to a dear one in need.. I'm right here! Maybe you want to 'pick my brain' about touring, songwriting, living the dream, or I can give you a private mini-concert.. Whatever it is, I'm all yours for half an hour!
We'll schedule a 30 minute phone call, Skype or Facetime chat. We can talk about anything you want.
INCLUDES:
You & me; One-on-One!

support.title: ON SALE: ✫⇢ Music City Tour ⇠✫
support.descp:
(Price Drop From $750!)
Music City Personal Tour Guide - I'm all yours for an afternoon and an evening in my home town, Nashville, Tennessee! Come to Music City and I'll take you around to all of the hot spots!
We can hit the legendary honky-tonks on Lower Broadway, the famous recording studios in Berry Hill, the publishing houses on Music Row, drink coffee with the hipsters in East Nashville, go for a nature walk or hike at Radnor Lake, visit the world renowned guitar shops, or a number of other fun things Nashville has to offer! I'll take you and a guest for a delicious dinner at one of my favorite local restaurants, and then leave you to explore Nashville for yourself.. You may never want to leave!
✱ Nashville is a mecca for recovery and healing. We can go to any one of a dozen different support group meetings, or a meditation if you're into that sort of thing..
✱ We'll need to schedule a mutually convenient time, preferably a few months in advance.
✱ Your travel to and from Nashville are not included; nor is your overnight accommodations. Dinner is limited to you and one (1) guest and does not include adult beverages.
✱ If selected, this reward expires one year from completion date of this campaign - March 27, 2019
INCLUDES:
Music City Guided Tour
THE FALLOW YEAR cd

support.title: Soul-Session
support.descp:
Your Soul Session is a one-on-one workshop of delving deeper into your own truth of self-discovery. I have developed a method of working with people that allows for deeper healing in the truth of your story. While this method developed out of my song co-writing experiences, this is NOT just for songwriters! In person or via Skype/Facetime, we'll spend an intensive three hour session, just you and me, getting real, and going deep. I'll stretch you a little, but I'll be gentle and respectful of your comfort level. By the end of our session you'll have the heart and bones of a Soul-Session - be it a song that we write, a story, a poem, or just some private thoughts for your journey ahead. You can take it from there!
Being able to get to the core of my 'stuff' through this process that I have created has been one of my greatest tools. I can help you get to yours too. Lets find a mutually convenient time and place to make it happen!
✱ NOTE: Notwithstanding all my years in therapy and recovery, I am not a professional in the field of mental health, addiction, or family issues. That said, I would love to talk, and if necessary, I can recommend some great resources that might be useful to you.
✱ If selected, this reward expires one year from completion date of this campaign - March 27, 2019
INCLUDES:
Soul-Session
THE FALLOW YEAR signed CD + digital download

support.title: ON SALE: ✫⇢ Custom Song ⇠✫
support.descp:
I'll write a custom song just for you or someone you know. You'll end up with a completed song that will be just like you - one of a kind! Let's discuss some details of what you have in mind. I am extremely proud of the previous custom songs that I've written! I'll record a simple solo demo of the song for you to keep.
I've written custom songs for birthdays, anniversaries, graduations, new babies, or just for love and friendship. One custom song that I wrote turned out to be a cowrite with Guy Clark! So, you never know what could happen!
✱ For an additional fee, you may choose to add "The Nashville Treatment" to your song. I'll hire a professional recording studio, engineer, and bring in a few world-class musicians to create a fully developed sounding finished product!
INCLUDES:
Custom Song
5× THE FALLOW YEAR cd
THE FALLOW YEAR Exclusive T-shirt

support.title: Solo House Concert
support.descp:
I'll come sing my heart out in your living room for you and as many friends as the space will allow. You can make song requests ahead of time. I'll play two sets of about 45 minutes each with a break in between for hanging out a bit -- it'll be super fun!
This show is NOT for commercial resale, but you are welcome to solicit donations to cover costs. For audiences over 25 people or for any outdoor performance, a sound system will be required. Travel and hotel lodging are additional; it'll be most economical for you if we find a date that corresponds with an upcoming tour. I'll do my best to make it work well for everyone. US/Canada only. European concerts are possible with additional costs of transportation, and contingent on tour routing.
✱ If selected, this reward expires one year from completion date of this campaign - March 27, 2019
INCLUDES:
Solo House Concert
THE FALLOW YEAR cd

support.title: Tribute Concert w Custom Song
support.descp:
In Honor / In Memoriam:
Is there someone in your community you would like to honor, memorialize, or pay tribute to? Perhaps someone who has had some victory or land-mark in their recovery? Perhaps a beloved leader? Perhaps someone who has been tragically lost to mental illness, substance abuse, and/or family issues? Perhaps a family member of someone who was lost. There is healing, understanding, and refuge when celebrating and mourning in communion. Lets bring attention to these issues and bring the conversation to the next level.
I'll spend some time with you gathering some stories, experiences, anecdotes, special moments that you've had with your person so that I can write a custom song about them, and present it at the concert.
If you or your organization does not have a performance-type space to utilize, I will come to your Community House, Library, Church, Treatment Center, 12-step Recovery Club House, Prison, or other appropriate venue, and present a concert in their honor or in their memory.
✱ Add their name ("in memory of ___" OR "in honor of ___"). Or your Logo / Company Name to the album artwork packaging for a fee of an additional $1,000 - that's $1,250 less than that reward on its own.
✱ I am not a mental health professional. I am a creative artist with many years involvement in my own experiential healing modalities.
✱ If selected, this reward expires one year from completion date of this campaign - March 27, 2019
INCLUDES:
5× THE FALLOW YEAR cd

support.title: 2-day Soul-Session Small Group Workshop
support.descp:
I will come to your company or organization for an intensive 2-day Soul Session Group Workshop.

Bearing witness to anothers' story, and having your own story heard by others is an extremely powerful experience - one that can lead to breakthroughs in all aspects of your life. We will all gather together, and one at a time, I will work with each participant on their Soul-Session in front of the group.
You may wish for the executive staff of your company or organization to come together in a meaningful way. Empowering values and virtues like Vulnerability, Self-Honesty, Empathy, Courage (Trust) and Communication.
Maximum - 8 people
✱ Add your Logo / Company Name Placement to the album artwork packaging for a reduced fee of an additional $1,000
✱ Travel and accommodation not included.
✱ Must be scheduled at least one month in advance of desired workshop date.
✱ I am not a mental health professional. I am a creative artist with many years involvement in my own experiential healing modalities.
✱ If selected, this reward expires one year from completion date of this campaign - March 27, 2019
INCLUDES:
8× THE FALLOW YEAR cd
